description.narrative: The socio-economic situation and its impact on the situation of mothers and children, as well as the recommendations from programme evaluation, are analyzed to better influence social policies and budgeting, and strengthen evidence-based programming.

sector.narrative: Building evaluation capacity in UNICEF and the UN system
Building global / regional / national stakeholder evaluation capacity
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The socio-economic situation and its impact on the situation of mothers and children, as well as the recommendations from programme evaluation, are analyzed to better influence social policies and budgeting, and strengthen evidence-based programming.

description.narrative: In the course of 2019 significant achievements have been made to better measure and monitor the situation of children and women in Madagascar. The most significant achievement is the completion of the 2018 MICS which informed the baseline report to monitor progress towards the SDGs and the preparation of the new country programme 2021-2023. Under the leadership of the Regional Office, UNICEF conducted a Formative Evaluation of the 2015-2020 Country Programme which provided key recommendations for the new country programme cycle. The evaluation report is currently being revised and it will be published in early 2020. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
